SEARCH
Package game.online

Class OnlineGameLogic

java.lang.Object
game.online.OnlineGameLogic
public class OnlineGameLogic extends Object
The OnlineGameLogic class contains the core game logic for managing an online multiplayer game. It handles player turns, game state updates, and communication between the server and clients. Key Responsibilities: - Manage the flow of the game, including player turns and game-ending conditions. - Handle player disconnections gracefully and adjust the game state accordingly. - Broadcast game updates and messages to all connected players. - Validate and process player inputs, both local and remote. Key Features: - Supports interactive gameplay for multiple players in an online environment. - Handles the final round and endgame logic, including score calculation. - Provides utility methods for broadcasting messages and managing player input. - Ensures synchronization between the server and clients during gameplay. Dependencies: - Deck – Represents the deck of cards used in the game. - Player – Represents each player in the game. - TurnManager – Manages the turn order of players. - Parade – Handles the parade row and card removal logic. - Scoring – Calculates scores and determines the winner. - SocketPacket – Used for communication between the server and clients. Assumptions: - The server is running and all players are connected before the game starts. - The game ends when all non-host players disconnect or the game logic concludes. Utility Methods: - playOnlineTurn – Manages the main game loop for online gameplay. - onlineLastRound – Handles the logic for the final round of the game. - endGameOnline – Processes the endgame logic, including discarding cards and scoring. - broadcastToAll – Sends messages or updates to all connected players. - flushInputBuffer – Clears any unwanted input from the buffer. - handlePlayerDisconnection – Handles the removal of disconnected players and adjusts the game state. - buildMenuMessage – Constructs the menu message displayed to players during their turn.

  • Method Details

    • playOnlineTurn

      public static void playOnlineTurn(Deck deck, ArrayList<Player> playerList, TurnManager turnManager, boolean isTwoPlayerGame, List<ObjectOutputStream> outputs, List<ObjectInputStream> inputs, Scanner sc)
      Retrieves the server's IP address for clients to connect. Iterates through the network interfaces to find the first active IPv4 address. Returns: - A String representing the server's IP address. - If no valid IP address is found, returns "Unable to determine IP address". Exceptions: - Handles SocketException for network interface errors.

    • onlineLastRound

      public static void onlineLastRound(Deck deck, ArrayList<Player> playerList, TurnManager turnManager, boolean isTwoPlayerGame, List<ObjectOutputStream> outputs, List<ObjectInputStream> inputs, Scanner sc) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Handles the logic for the final round of the game in an online multiplayer environment. Ensures all players take their final turns and resolves the game state. Responsibilities: - Broadcast final round announcements and updates to all players. - Process player moves during the final round. - Handle player disconnections gracefully and adjust the game state accordingly. Parameters: - deck – The Deck object representing the deck of cards used in the game. - playerList – A list of Player objects representing the players in the game. - turnManager – The TurnManager object managing the turn order. - isTwoPlayerGame – A boolean indicating whether the game is a two-player game. - outputs – A list of ObjectOutputStream objects for sending data to clients. - inputs – A list of ObjectInputStream objects for receiving data from clients. - sc – A Scanner object for reading user input. Exceptions: - Handles IOException and ClassNotFoundException for network communication errors.
      Throws:
      IOException
      ClassNotFoundException

    • endGameOnline

      public static void endGameOnline(ArrayList<Player> playerList, boolean isTwoPlayerGame, TurnManager turnManager, List<ObjectOutputStream> outputs, List<ObjectInputStream> inputs, Scanner sc) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Processes the endgame logic, including discarding cards and calculating scores. Handles the final actions for all players and determines the winner. Responsibilities: - Prompt players to discard two cards from their hand. - Broadcast endgame updates and final scores to all players. - Handle player disconnections gracefully and adjust the game state accordingly. - Transition back to the main menu after the game concludes. Parameters: - playerList – A list of Player objects representing the players in the game. - isTwoPlayerGame – A boolean indicating whether the game is a two-player game. - turnManager – The TurnManager object managing the turn order. - outputs – A list of ObjectOutputStream objects for sending data to clients. - inputs – A list of ObjectInputStream objects for receiving data from clients. - sc – A Scanner object for reading user input. Exceptions: - Handles IOException and ClassNotFoundException for network communication errors.
      Throws:
      IOException
      ClassNotFoundException

    • broadcastToAll

      public static void broadcastToAll(ArrayList<Player> playerList, SocketPacket sp) throws IOException
      Sends messages or updates to all connected players in the game. Ensures that all players receive the same game state and announcements. Parameters: - playerList – A list of Player objects representing the players in the game. - sp – A SocketPacket object containing the message or update to broadcast. Exceptions: - Handles IOException for network communication errors.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • flushInputBuffer

      public static void flushInputBuffer()
      Clears any unwanted input from the input buffer to prevent accidental input values. Ensures that the input stream is clean before processing new input. Exceptions: - Handles IOException for input stream errors.
